content.content: 14th April Emergency Executive Hi all, Unhiding the original text following awareness and fixes implemented by other protocols.  The CRVV1ETHSTETH-A oracle was frozen in the April 13th emergency executive at 22:25 UTC to successfully mitigate a potential vulnerability. This proposal was communicated and recommended for voting to delegates to prevent any adverse impact to MakerDAO. Similarly, the Protocol Engineering team has been engaged in ongoing communication with GovAlpha and external parties to manage potential impacts. During the previous week, existing vaults of the CRVV1ETHSTETH-A vault-type were not able to withdraw collateral unless they paid off their full debt, users were not at risk of liquidation during this time. In summary; Users could not:  Draw DAI Withdraw collateral unless debt is fully paid back. Get liquidated  Users could:  Add collateral Pay back DAI  As a result, last week’s executive did not include the previously scheduled increases to the CRVV1ETHSTETH-A debt ceiling parameters. Protocol Engineering and GovAlpha will provide a forthcoming update, and post mortem with additional information.  Due to the technical issues referenced above, April 22nd’s Executive will propose to replace and reactivate the Curve stETH/ETH Oracle. This will involve:  Removing permissions on the previous oracle implementation. Adding permissions on the new oracle implementation. Replicating the whitelist for this oracle on the new implementation. This action will restore full functionality to the Curve stETH/ETH oracle and CRVV1ETHSTETH-A vaults.
Thank you to token holders and delegates able to respond!
Any further info on this? Have a CDP open and can’t find any detail here.
Responded in DM. Expecting to have a fix deployed later this week once coordination with other protocols has concluded.

Current target for further information and post-mortems is May 9th. I believe the plan is to have a DAO-level post-mortem, with myself as the primary author alongside a technical post-mortem produced by Protocol Engineering. They might end up combined depending on how much duplication there is. Separately, GovAlpha will also be posting some details and statistics around the response time from delegates on roughly the same timeline as the postmortems.  Apologies to everyone for the less-than-ideal transparency over the last week or so. We’ve tried to be as transparent and open as possible given the circumstances (full details of which should come later.)

Apologies for not updating everyone prior to May 9th. It looks like we’re blocked on posting the post-mortem by external dependencies. We don’t have a good estimate as to how long we’ll be waiting for this, unfortunately, but it’s likely to be at least another few weeks.
This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
